message.content:
cs.DB, cs.LO, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.PL 

This paper deals with the extension of Datalog, a logic programming language used in databases, with aggregates such as min, max, count, and sum. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the cs.DB (Databases) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a solution that extends the declarative least-fixpoint semantics of Horn Clauses, which is related to the cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) sub-category. The paper also discusses optimization techniques used in the bottom-up implementation approach adopted by many Datalog systems, which is related to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-categories. Finally, the paper proposes an extension of the semantics and optimization techniques of Datalog, which is related to the cs.PL (Programming Languages) sub-category.
